message.content:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: public List<String> ExecuteCommand (String command) {
    List<String> result = new ArrayList<>();
    try {
        // Send command
        byte[] cmd = (command + "\n").getBytes();
        bais.write(cmd);
        bais.flush();

        // Read response
        byte[] buffer = new byte[1024];
        int bytesRead;
        while ((bytesRead = baos.read(buffer)) != -1) {
            String response = new String(buffer, 0, bytesRead);
            result.add(response);
        }
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    return result;
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the ExecuteCommand method, we first send the command to the server by writing it to the input stream of the channel. We then read the response from the server by reading from the output stream of the channel. The response is read into a byte array buffer, and then converted into a string and added to the result list. This process continues until there is no more data to read from the output stream, indicated by the read method returning -1.
